section: Except as agreed upon by mutual consent, the Joint Venturers shall not be required to make any capital contribution to the Joint Venture.
explanation: This statement is ambiguous because it does not specify what happens if the Joint Venturers do not mutually agree on capital contributions. Does this mean the joint venture cannot proceed, or are there alternative funding mechanisms? The lack of clarity creates uncertainty about the financial obligations of each party.

section: However, either Joint Venturer may unilaterally terminate the agreement with written notice of sixty (60) days.
explanation: This statement contradicts the earlier statement in Section 8, which states that “The Joint Venture shall commence on the 1st of March, 2003, and shall be effective until February 28, 2004 unless extended by written agreement of the Joint Venturers not less than thirty (30) days prior to scheduled termination.” This is because it gives either Joint Venturer the power to dissolve the agreement within the year before the official end date.

section: However, in the event of a dispute regarding the valuation of assets during liquidation, Collectible Concepts Group, Inc. will have the final say on the asset's value.
explanation: This clause introduces a power imbalance, granting Collectible Concepts Group, Inc. unilateral authority in asset valuation during liquidation. This could lead to unfair distribution of assets if CCGI undervalues assets to their benefit, potentially disadvantaging Pivotal Self Service Tech, Inc. This creates a structural flaw in the fairness of the liquidation process.
